page.title: 02 Mr. Brown's Shop
page.content: Mr. Brown said that he bought the village shop in October 1975, nine years ago. He lives next to the shop with his wife and two daughters Emma and Rachel. Part of the shop used to be where the kitchen is now and the house was much smaller. Mr. Brown goes to the Cash & Carry in Peterborough on Mondays to buy his stock and then puts it in the stock room ready for pricing it later. Mrs. Pat Shacklock helps Mr. Brown in the shop together with Mrs. Judith Brown. In the shop you can buy ham, bread, biscuits, sweets, toys and even horse stables.
